detaileddescription.para: While the SC application does not require a great deal of work for platform deployment, the following are some general guidlines.

CFS Stored Command requires that two message ID's be put in the CFS Scheduler table for proper operation. Those message ID's are SC_SEND_HK_MID, which should be sent out at the housekeeping request interval, and SC_1HZ_WAKEUP_MID, which needs to be sent out every second.
CFS Stored Command generates telemetry when it receives the housekeeping request. Its telemetry message ID is SC_HK_TLM_MID.

The user should look through the SC platform configuration header file to make sure the default configuration meets the needs of the mission. Special care should be taken with the following parameters: SC_ATS_FILE_NAME, SC_RTS_FILE_NAME, SC_APPEND_FILE_NAME and SC_TIME_TO_USE. The SC_ATS_FILE_NAME, SC_RTS_FILE_NAME and SC_APPEND_FILE_NAME must contain a path in EEPROM because this is where SC looks for tables upon startup. If there is a PowerOn reset, then there will be no files in any other filesystem besides EEPROM. The SC_TIME_TO_USE specifies the type of time format SC should use. If the time format is set to anything but SC_USE_CFE_TIME, then the user must take special care when creating ATS commands to take this time difference into account.
Also, please be aware that SC has a performance ID, SC_APPMAIN_PERF_ID, that keeps track of the performance of the SC app.
Next: CFS Stored Command Commands Prev: CFS Stored Command Requirements
